reviews.text: Worth it for the location alone. The Aris could not be more central. It is located just behind the Grand Place and is about five minutes walk from Brussels Central Station.Comfortable and good value for money...
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 2 nights at the Aris Centre Hotel. What a great location! It was a 5 minute walk from Central Station, about a block away from The Grand Place, and very near numerous restaurants and shops. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast, included, was one of the most extensive we had on our European trip. The room and bathroom were very clean and nice sized. Our room was on the top floor and there were 2 fast, reasonably sized elevators. The biggest negative was that the internet connection in the lobby was very expensive to use. I would, however, definitely stay at the Aris Centre if I returned to Brussels.
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.text: Great location. This hotel is an easy walk from the central station. The staff was helpful and pleasant. We got a room on the topfloor at the front of the building and we had two great views.
reviews.title: great location
it is the best buy for the money
reviews.text: We were booked here by our associate. We paid 89 euros Very cheap by European standards. Because I had read tripadvisor evaluations, I came prepared. Yes, there is no shampoo, I brought a small tube for our use. Yes, the pillows are very thin, but that is quickly solved by asking for extra pillows at the desk. The room is spartan , the TV is small. You can't even buy a bottle of water . There is practically no service, and no bell hops.But it is clean and very comfortable.The breakfast is sufficient, but no coffee shop nor room service. But, right across the street you have the best Belgian waffles in the world. Also rows of cafes and restaurants all walking distance from the hotel. It is so ideally located that you walk to Grand Place, walk to the train station, walk to the Beaux Arts museum and to the bus stop of the hop off-hop bus is just a few minutes away next to the train station. It is not noisy specially if you ask or an interior room. For the price we paid I felt we got a really good deal. Do not make the mistake of booking though agencies that get into the web site when you access the hotel. Go directly to the web site of the hotel. I post this because I find that the critics have helped me a lot. I hope mine helps others. Conchita Sevilla, Madrid Spain
stayed at the aris for the weekend of the beer festival so ideally located near grand place, and also close to central station.
reviews.title: good value at the aris

reviews.text: Just got back from a nice weekend trip to Brussels. The Aris hotel was perfect - I was flying in from Africa and meeting a friend from Amsterdam so it was important to have a place (1) near the train station and (2) with a decent price. I found a weekend price for a twin room of 64 euros including breakfast which I thought was great! The room was clean, neat, big enough and you cannot beat the convenience of the hotel. 10 mins from the station and 3 minutes from Grand Place. I would definitely stay there again. BTW, the best frites I found were at Au Pot Carre -- don't miss them!!!
reviews.title: Another great review of a really good hotel

reviews.text: As previous reviewers have written, this hotel is in a great location, a few steps from the Grand Place and 5 minutes from the Central station. There's also a taxi rank nearby, and many shops and restaurants.

It is near the Grand Place, which should be a focus of any visit. It is near the Central Station so easy to get to (downhill on the way to the hotel). The rooms are fine, the breakfast is good.

Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: Here are the buts...I am thinking of them as summer approaches and I have booked another hotel for my upcoming trip.

1) Last year I booked by visiting the hotel several months ahead of my planned summer stay. I got there and my reservation, at 85 Euros, was all in fine shape. When I went for a stroll and came back from a different direction, there was a sign in the window saying the rate was 75 Euros. I asked for this rate and they would not change my rate, telling me I was already well below the 'normal' price of about 200 Euros. Give me a break.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good value for money

reviews.text: 2) I got a room facing a brick wall across a narrow alley, with a small restaurant below. Having stayed in about a dozen Brussels hotels, this is the worst view ever!
